documents.document:
Theatrical Events in Los Angeles During Summer

The City of Angeles is equipped with the wealth of numerous events that take place in it throughout the each year. These Los Angeles events have become a reason of fame of this city. Some of these events are organized on annual basis and thus they have got their pivotal role in different event calendars for the people who visit Los Angeles. These event calendars serve not only the residents of this city but also serve the outside visitors as guide. Before you plan to go to LA, have a look at these calendars and this will add to the beauty of your visit to this city.

The following is a quick list of some of my favorite theatrical festivals during summer:

The Wicked Wilde Shakespeare Festival – This is a five-week summer theater festival offered by the Los Angeles Women's Shakespeare Company. Streamlined, gender-bending versions of classic plays are presented during the festival every year.

The Will Geer Theatricum Botanicum – The event covers classic plays in a unique atmosphere of woods. This atmosphere serves as a get-away for the audience and adds maximum beauty to those who especially visit this city.

Shakespeare by the Sea Performances – Is an annual festival that offers free theatrical performances and thus has become a tradition and source of entertainment for people in Los Angeles and also for those who visit here.

West Hollywood Summer Performing Arts Series – This event is based on classical Shakespeare’s performances and is for free. This brings maximum people to the event and if you plan to go to this festival ensure that you reserve first.

If you’re searching for Los Angeles Events during summer, you can find as many in number as you want. You can visit the official websites of these LA Events to avoid any hassle.

Top Five Awards Based Los Angeles Events

If we call Los Angeles to be ‘the city of events’, it would not be wrong. The city accommodates maximum people by engaging in different events, festivals, exhibitions and workshops ranging from entertainment to IT world. If you plan to visit Los Angeles for your favorite events, you will find these events to be very high ranked on the basis of different quality standards. It’s really very hard to set rankings for Los Angeles events in any category. However, here are top five award shows in LA:

People’s Choice Awards – These awards are given to the outstanding talent in the fields of films and television. The viewers of the films or television segment play the role of judges and hence they have the final authority in terms of votes that’s why called ‘people’s choice awards’.

Annie Awards – These awards are based on animated films and are given to those people who play their important role in these films in any of the field.

Emmy Awards – These awards are given to those who perform excellence in television programs. Emmys are considered equivalent to the Academy awards, granny Awards or Tony Awards and are organized by National Academy of Television Arts and Sciences.

Grammy Awards – National Academy of Recording Arts and Science give these awards to those who perform outstandingly in musical arts. The awards are equivalent to Emmy awards and Academy Awards.

Academy Awards – Academy Awards are also known as Oscars and are given by the Academy of Motion Picture of Science and Arts to the excellent film directors, performers and writers. Academy Awards are equivalent to Grammy Awards and Emmy Awards.

The exact date and time for these awards based LA Events is available at their websites. Before you go to one of these Los Angeles Events, make sure that your schedule meets the official time and date of the event.

Top Five Picks from Annual Los Angeles Events in October

Los Angeles is among those cities in the world that probably came into existence for events. These events make this city full of life all the times and never let it exhaust. Los Angeles, also called the city of Angels is rightly termed as the ‘entertainment capital of the world’. The events are held majorly in the fields of films, music, dance, theatre, painting and food etc. The city remains busy with events, fairs and festivals throughout the year and it’s really difficult to cover all those events in a single blog. However, it seems valuable to share some of the events that one likes the most in some part of the year.

So here are the top five events for the month of October that are held annually in LA:

LA Luxury Chocolate Salon: This annual chocolate vents takes place in every October at Pasadena center and covers different chocolate flavors, videos, discussions, competitions and lessons. This event can be an epic of entertainment for chocolate lovers.

Taste of the Soul Festival: Taste of the Soul festival is based on the positive aspects of American and Africans with a taste of everything feel Black. The festival encourages entertainment in an atmosphere of peace, pride and pleasure. The event will take place on 15th of October, 2011.

Long Beach Marathon: This annual marathon event is unique of its nature as there is a big number of participants in it including kids also. There is entertainment, food stops and scenic beauty all in this event.

Day of the Dead: Day of Dead is a Mexican celebration to remembering the old ones – relatives and dear ones through processions, dances and music.

Los Angeles Lithuanian Fair: This is the largest Lithuanian event outside Lithuania and is based on Lithuania culture, music, dance and history through different events. The event takes place annually in October.

The schedule for these Los Angeles Events can be adjusted after matching with the real date and time if it’s changed - LA Events

Labor Day Events Merge Los Angelinos and All Others

Labor Day is celebrated in the whole world with a difference in date. In the United States, it’s celebrated in September at the end of week days. Though Labor Day has its roots in the blood of working class, and it was first time observed during 1878, yet it became a federal holiday in 1894. Today, this day is more famous as an off day, celebrations and events that are organized annually on this day. Different people pass this day differently – some celebrate it in a full fledge way while others celebrate it silently by taking rest at home.

Whatever the way you make to celebrate (or pass) Labor Day, it’s great fun to go to one of these LA events. There are theatrical performances, musical concerts, food festivals, painting exhibits and many more celebrations become the subject of Labor Day events. These events and festivities of this day lure many people and visitors throughout the world to Los Angles as most of these events are a true depiction of mix up of different cultures and ethnicities at a single place.

If you’re planning to visit Los Angeles at the end of this summer, a look at the calendars can add to the planning for your visit to this city of ultimate entertainment. In these calendars, you will also see some of these LA events are for free and thus will cost you nothing in return to the entertainment that you will have through them. Search these events online and then confirm their exact schedule to avoid any disruption in your visit. I will keep on updating you about the Events in the Los Angeles so keep reading my blog. Good luck to your next visit to one of these LA Events!

Make Your Valentine Special through LA Upcoming Events

Valentine’s Day is one day that is special for the reason it brings the message of love and that’s why there are lots of people in the world that anxiously wait for this day. The couples in the whole world celebrate this day; however, celebrating it in Los Angeles is special for so many reasons. The romantic city is decorated on this event like a bride and thus provides you with an atmosphere perfectly matching your romance. There are so many events that take place in Los Angeles annually, so a look at the upcoming LA events will help you make your schedule perfect.

There are so many events taking place on daily basis in Los Angeles, so planning one’s visit to this city needs some home work. There are different categories of events taking place in the city so if you search them online, the best way to searching them is searching them categorically. There are theatres, festivals, concerts and dance parties and even restaurants based events and you can select one of these LA Events for making your Valentine’s Day special.

Los Angeles is one of the best places in the world to spend Valentine’s Day with so many colorful activities and events to beautify your day and to provide you an atmosphere that brings your romance out of you and transfers it to your beloved one. If it does not happen so, you never were a romantic person or you can claim to be one of the most unromantic persons of the world.

Search online for Upcoming LA Events in Los Angeles for the next Valentine’s Day and you will surely get an event of your choice. Plan it today so that you get maximum time for the adjustment of your schedule. Good luck!

Valentine’s Day Events in Los Angeles

The city of Angeles, Los Angeles also written as LA is the city that never exhausts. The days are beautiful and nights colorful with lots of events taking place at the same time at different places. The city becomes the first choice for many visitors for different events taking place here and thus justifies its title ‘the entertainment capital’ of the world. Valentine’s Day is every especial in Los Angeles for people of different age groups, ethnicities, cultures, regions and tastes. If you’ve got some taste, this city never leaves you alone.

If you’re romantic and want to spend some good time with your sweetheart, Los Angeles is the best place in the whole world. Budget is a matter for so many people, but this city accommodates these budget matters by providing budget-friendly romantic times in the form of different events. You may accompany your sweetheart (your Valentine) at a simple sea-shore walk, can enjoy a beautiful sun-set together or can join some musical or dance event held in the city at that time to beautify your Valentine’s Day.

If you’re planning to visit this city during next weekend, make sure that you pre-plan everything and complete your home work so that everything goes smooth. There are some Valentine’s Day events in Los Angeles that are free and everyone can go there. You can search these Los Angeles Events online and can add some fun to your entertainment without spending money on tickets. However, it’s recommended to note the time and date for these Los Angeles Events and also the seats reservation to avoid any hassle on the event day.

Whatever plan you make for the upcoming Valentine’s Day events, the most important point remains the ensuring the date and time schedule of the events whether you’re from Los Angeles or from some other place.

LA Film Events that You Should Not Miss

Films always attract attention of film makers and film viewers so whenever there is some film event, they naturally don’t go unnoticed. Different organizations conduct different types of film events throughout the world. These film events not only provide the film viewers and film makers with entertainment but also quench their thirst to meet the film stars at some of the events like film premieres or Hall of Fame etc. Los Angeles also written as LA is famous for so many other reasons but entertainment is the most dominant aspect of all these reasons that add to the fame of this city. The presence of Hollywood adds to introduction of LA.

If you like films and are planning to visit Los Angeles, a look at the upcoming film events calendar will help you plan your visit in a better way. The varied types of events include film festivals, fairs, award ceremonies, celebrities’ walks and film premieres etc. The start and end of every event is different and the organizers try to make both these times most memorable for those who attend these events. There are music and foods, drinking and chat ups to decorate these events.

From old classical films to 3D animations, there are all genres of films events organized in Los Angeles. If you have a taste of watching old classical films, there are annual film festivals like Cinecon that will not only provide you with entertainment but also is equipped with people of the same tastes. So, you get a chance to discuss with them. There are also some very rare film posters that you can get from such events. This is just one example to quote here about Los Angeles film events. If you like comedy films, there are comedy film festivals as well in Los Angeles.

Search online for the LA Upcoming Events through film calendars and you will have a better picture about the choice you could make. Adding fun to your visit through some top LA Events will make it memorable. Have a look at Los Angeles Events under the category of annual film festivals and perfect your plan. Good luck!

Plan for Upcoming Film Festivals in Los Angeles

Though Los Angeles is no need an introduction when entertainment is the topic of discussion, yet Hollywood is the factor that makes this City of Angeles a worth-visiting place for so many people. You started a film debate and Los Angeles just became its part consciously or unconsciously. The presence of Hollywood, Film fairs, film festivals, and events based on celebrity walks, film premieres and film awards are some of the main events that lure film makers and film viewers to this city – the entertainment capital of the world.

If we talk about specifically for the film festival in Los Angeles, there are events for different genres of films like for short films, comedy films, romantic film, classic films and animated films. Some of the LA (Los Angeles) film events are also based on screening of films and after this; some of the films make their way through some other film festivals also. The varieties of film festivities also include musical events and eating and drinking fun. There are different types of festivals for different tastes of people.

If you’re planning to visit Los Angeles, complete your online research or gather information from some other resources to make your plan a perfect one. There are some festivals that are five-day or event ten-day long and include other events as well in them.

There are some film festivals that focus only old classics films and Cinecon is such one festival. The event also shows some very old classic still films with piano music. On such LA event, you get a change to interact with people of your type and can also buy rare pictures and posters of old classic films.

Searching online for LA Events will bring you as much information as you want to plan for a better visit to this city of Angels. All the necessary information for these LA Upcoming Events is available at their official websites. Make you visit memorable through these Los Angeles Events. Good luck!

Beautifying Your Visit through LA Upcoming Events

There are lots of places in the world to visit for having good time and Los Angeles is one of them. Though Los Angeles aka LA is not matchless in all its aspects, yet there are some points where this city has no match. Among these points, entertainment is the most dominant point. This presence of Hollywood in this city adds to its introduction and musical events and dance parties coupled with foodie and film events collectively make this city an entertainment hub hence called ‘entertainment capital of the world’. If you’re planning to visit this city or already living there and want to go to one of the LA Upcoming Events, this blog is for you.

There are two approaches to be a part of these <b><a href="http://www.lacanvas.com/">Los Angeles Events</a></b>. If annual events are the targets, then let’s put those people aside who regularly go to these events. The rest of people either go to these events after someone refer them here or they get information by searching these events online. Searching online is one option that should be followed because finally, you get the exact information from there. You visit their official website and get the latest schedule of events that you want to participate in. Another benefit of online search is that you can get maximum information about the event and can also contact the event organizers to have authentic information if there is any ambiguity.

The next step to be a part of these <b><a href="http://www.lacanvas.com/">LA Events</a></b> is searching for events calendar of a month that matches your visiting plan. There are some Los Angeles Events that come under the category of both months i.e. if you’re planning to visit Los Angeles in September, you will find some events taking place at the end of September and spreading up to October. Note these events dates carefully to avoid any hassle.

Hopefully, these tips for LA Upcoming Events guide you plan your visit in a better way. Good luck!

LA Weekly Events Calendar

Our LA weekly events calendar is here to keep you hip and up to date on what's worthwhile and happening in the greatest city in the world. Our calendar highlights LA's weekly events so you won't have any nights stuck on your couch watching old, syndicated episodes of Friends and Seinfeld.

We like to keep our weekly events varied so you have a wide gamut of opportunities from gallery openings to live music to plays. You won't find a more comprehensive list of LA weekly events, so stop by our website each week to stay in the know of what everyone else is doing. There's not just a list of dates and LA's weekly events either; we will let you know what to expect and a give you a good reason to endure Los Angeles' world-famous traffic to get there.

Along with knowing what's up with everything going on around us, we here at LA Canvas sure like to throw our own parties and events, which we feature on our website and LA weekly events calendar; we can guarantee you'll regret missing them. Furthermore, apart from our calendar featuring the best of LA weekly event, LACANVAS.com posts everyday on our blogs about music, food, art and everything else we like. We also have a tendency to give away items such as Urbanears headphones or tickets to some of our featured events. We want you to be cultured and in the know, so when meeting people at the unique events you find on our weekly events calendar, you have something to talk about other than the day's beautiful beach weather.

You wouldn't want to miss anything because you’d forgotten to check out our calendar of LA weekly events, now would you? We didn’t think so.

Los Angeles Events Hotspots

We’ve got sunshine year-round, some of the country’s best sports teams and the beach. With so much at our fingertips, there’s no reason to waste time at sub-par Los Angeles events. The parties, culture and movies are, in fact, what makes the city of Angels so great. As a resident, you can go snowboarding and surfing on the same day, and that’s only the beginning. Here’s a primer on finding the best Los Angeles events.

Concerts: For the best in live music Los Angeles events, there are some venues you can’t miss. Weston’s Troubadour on Santa Monica Boulevard, which has been open since 1957’s impressive resume includes Elton John’s first concert in the United States, and is famous for kicking out John Lennon for heckling the Smothers Brothers. All types of music are still represented at the small venue - so you’re sure to find something you like.

If you’re looking for a larger scene, don’t miss the Hollywood Bowl. The world-famous outdoor amphitheater has hosted all types of Los Angeles events from parties to performances of Broadway’s RENT, and always has fireworks during the summer.

Comedy: The Upright Citizens’ Brigade’s Los Angeles theatre is across the street from the Scientology Celebrity Centre. It looks like a real version of the Haunted Mansion, but don’t worry, no harm will come from attending any of UCB’s hilarious comedy shows. They have everything from stand-up to sketch comedy, or if you’re interested in the art of improv, you can enroll in their improv school program. UCB hosts some of the funniest Los Angeles events you can find.

Theater: There is no better place for theater in all of Los Angeles than the Pantages Theatre. Right now it’s hosting the national Broadway tour of Chicago, starring Christie Brinkley. Productions are always changing, and there’s sure to be something for you, no matter what type of Los Angeles events you prefer. After Chicago, The Addams Family will reside onstage for two weeks before Million Dollar Quartet starts its run. Don't miss out.

The Hottest in This Week’s LA Events

LA knows how to party. With hundreds of daily gallery openings, concerts and more, LA events are top of the line. LA CANVAS is here to bring you the best of LA events each week, and we’re pretty good at it. Here are a few of our favorite events this week:

Tuesday 5/22: Our sincerest apologies to all the other LA venues, but for this Tuesday night, The Bootleg has you beat. British songstress Lianne La Havas has made her way to the golden coast to show us what London has to offer, which in her case are infectious melodies you can’t help but enjoy - even as she sings about heartbreak.

Wednesday 5/23: The Upright Citizens Brigade Theatre holds a wide range of hilarious of LA events ranging from puppet shows to stand up comedy, and Wednesdays nights are no exception. A cast of about five comedians grab two people from the audience and immediately turn their Facebook pages into an unforgettable night of long-form improve.

Saturday 5/26: Silverlake is one of the most up and coming neighborhoods around, and their Silverlake Jubilee is an annual reminder of why you can’t afford to overlook it. It’s an LA event that brings together artists, musicians, comedians and food trucks for an all-day experience under the great Los Angeles sun.

Sunday 5/27: Relax after your long day of partying in Silverlake with a screening of Hayao Miyazaki’s Ponyo at the Cinefamily. It is an LA event, so the Japanese film will be presented in English, and you won’t have to worry about keeping up with the subtitles.

So there you have it - the best events LA has to offer this week. Make sure to check out lacanvas.com for a more extensive list of LA events as we update our calendar constantly with events we love - and we're pretty sure you will too.

Los Angeles Weekly Event Calendar

LA weekly events can’t be compared to the rest of the country. From parties at the top of hotels in Downtown Los Angeles to residencies at tiny clubs, LA weekly events can’t be beat.

Venues from West Hollywood to Downtown host recurring LA weekly events, with bands performing the same time slot each week for about a month. Many local artists such as Honeyhoney and Maniac have residencies at well known venues such as the Silver Lake Lounge or Hotel Café. Matt Chamberlain is finishing up a month long Tuesday night residency at the Mint – catch his last show on the 30th.

Apart from concerts, clubs and venues throw recurring parties, which are some of the most well known LA weekly events. La Cita, a small club in LA, is known for its Thursday night parties called Dance Right. The 21 and over dance party is one of the most hip LA weekly events for those who love to dance the night away.

However, if you’re busy on Thursdays, The Airliner in Lincoln Heights has been throwing its “Low End Theory” party every Wednesday night for the past five years. What started out as an experimental LA weekly event is now famous, featuring house DJs whose followings have grown immensely due to these parties.

If you’re not up to partying each week, but prefer enjoying the entertainment, make sure to check out the Upright Citizen’s Brigade Theater, which hosts recurring themed shows each week, such as their Facebook night, or Asssscat, a Saturday night special which usually features television or movie actors. Each show takes suggestions from the audience which form the content, so no two shows will ever be the same.

To stay up to date on the best of LA weekly events, make sure to check up on LACANVAS.com. We feature a calendar each month we’re constantly updating as we find more events we love.

This Week in LA Events

LA knows how to party. We have daily gallery openings, concerts and so much more more; LA events are top of the line. LA CANVAS is here to bring you the best of LA events each week, and we think we do it well. Here are a few of our favorite events happening this week:

Tuesday 6/12: Nite Jewel, aka Los Angeles-based singer-songwriter Ramona Gonzalez, is returning home from tour this week to play an awesome LA event at The Echo. Her debut album One Second of Love dropped earlier this year on Secretly Canadian, and it’s full of dark, grungy electro beats bumping under airy, layered R&B vocal melodies. If Ramona’s 2012 music video releases have proven anything, it’s that she’s a freakily good dancer with a twisted streak—so obviously, you’ll want to see her live. Paradise and Nicholas Krgovich are opening for what’s sure to be a slightly strange, but certainly fun LA event.

Saturday 6/11: Old Pasadena: A beautiful place to stop and smell the jasmine while you stroll in search of gourmet cupcakes, frozen yogurt, or fancy nick-knacks. But let’s not get too comfortable–it’s time again for this epicenter of all-things yuppie to open up its streets to the masses, luring them in with some good ol’ rock n’ roll for one of our favorite annual LA events. This year, Grimes, Cults and Grouplove headline this massive festival including four main stages and over 100 spontaneous performances. Don’t forget to stop by the LA CANVAS tent and say hi as you brave the madness.

So that’s it for this week. Make sure to check out LACANVAS.com for a more extensive list of LA events each week as we update our calendar constantly with events we love - and we’re sure you will too.

Latest in Los Angeles Events

LA CANVAS is a self-sustaining fountainhead of traditions outlining the numerous milestones, events and activities that configure Los Angeles. LA CANVAS exhibits the popularity of its city through detailed expositions and large scale photograph spreads, primarily focusing on the most up-to-date art, style, music and food that emerge from the boulevard. Thousands of LA CANVAS magazines are distributed throughout the city of Los Angeles to numerous shopping outlets, cafés and galleries. To bridge the gap between issues, LA CANVAS updates the latest events and happenings taking place on its website. Frequent followers are sent a rundown of the best goings-on by the LA Weekly Events.

The city of Los Angeles is well known to be a breeding ground for many renowned and newly emerging entertainers, artists, designers and any individual in possession of a creative mind and the passion to express his/her ideas. LA CANVAS is a liberated lifestyle periodical that associates its readers to this stream of modernization by disclosing the most recent and exhilarating contributions to materialize from the city's visionaries. Its covers a diversified collection, ranging from film and technology to fashion and music. Every single issue of LA Weekly Events is primarily devoted to the breakthrough of the city's greatest new vogue. The content of its pages is packed with profound profiles of abundant artists, sizzling site spotlights and vivacious snap shots for an audience that craves for every Hollywood spiced up news as much as it does the agitation of a gallery opening in the city centre. Permit yourself to undergo the pulsating ambience of Los Angeles through the eyes of LA CANVAS, illuminating the countless veiled secrets of the city resting in retail, nightlife, dining and abstraction.

The Inner-City Arts Foundation receives a significant fraction of LA Weekly Events takings. The Downtown Los Angeles Art Walk has declared LA CANVAS as its official magazine. Another remarkable point about the LA CANVAS issues is that it is printed in recycled paper using soy based inks. If you want the up-to-the-minute news hitting the LA artistic panorama, LA CANVAS can surely be of a great asset to you.

Discover the Colors of LA!

Follow the latest art, style, music and food happenings in Los Angeles Events; the city of angels, by visiting LACANVAS today! We stand as an independent LA entertainment HUB that disseminates latest events in all genres of social entertainment! That is why we pride ourselves by giving ourselves an all encompassing name of “LACANVAS”, missing no social color the modern culture in LA brings to tourists as well as residents.

LA CANVAS realizes your need to know the best and only the best of food and non-food entertainment. Our daily blog is a constant source of Los Angeles Events information while our monthly magazine serves your intrinsic need to explore and discover many hidden artistic platforms within LA! 20,000 copies of LACANVAS magazine and a weekly newsletter are considered the ultimate happening guide by our members, entertainment partners and LA information seekers. LA CANVAS E-Issue and Photo Gallery are designed specifically to cater the socialite events in all walks of life. Visit LA CANVAS today to get the up-to-date news stream on social events that would guide you to live your life to its fullest while in LA!

Join our page at www.facebook.com/lacanvasmag to win exciting prizes offered within many varieties of entertainment channels we foster! Share the good news with your friends and be the first to dine-in a scrumptious place or enjoy a live concert of your favorite star singer!

This Week in LA Events

LA knows how to party. We have daily gallery openings, concerts and so much more more; LA events are top of the line. LA CANVAS is here to bring you the best of LA events each week, and we think we do it well. Here are a few of our favorite events happening this week:

Wednesday 6/20: When was the last time you went to an LA event featuring three live accordion acts? If you’re anything like us, that answer is never. Bar Lubitsch is hosting a one of a kind evening program with accordion acts Ketchup Soup, Timur & The Dime Museum, and princessFrank & The Killsisters. This isn’t just your crazy uncle playing at the family party either - these acts can rock on the accordion like nothing you’ve heard before. The LA event is guaranteed to blow the house down - we just hope it won’t be literal.

Thursday 6/21: Next Thursday, LA CANVAS is taking over The Standard with a unique night of partying for a good cause. We’ve got eight of LA’s best street artists, including Mear One, Gregory Siff and Dee Dee Cheriel, at one LA event in order to paint on 8-ft cuts of premium denim. Then, !ITEM Denim will turn the artists’ creations into wearable art. After being exhibited at Project Las Vegas, the jeans will be auctioned off with all proceeds going towards the Art of Elysium, a non-profit which provides artistic workshops to children battling serious medical conditions. Oh yeah, did we mention it’s going to be an awesome party?

So that’s it for this week. Make sure to check out LACANVAS.com for a more extensive list of Events LAeach week as we update our calendar constantly with events we love - and we’re sure you will too.

This Week’s Los Angeles Events

We could never deny it -- we love LA. From the laying on the sand relaxing underneath the sun for hours to happening across celebrities as you walk around Hollywood, we really can’t imagine being anywhere else. Even thinking about my mornings sitting on the 110 in a mid-morning traffic jam, I still wouldn’t choose anywhere else. Los Angeles events are another major reason nobody wants to leave the city of Angels. Los Angeles events range from improv comedy to the annual Strawberry Festival in Ventura. Here are some we’re especially excited for this week.

6/23: Whoever thought cemeteries were single-purposed has never experienced a Los Angeles event at the Hollywood Forever Cemetery. On Saturday nights, the public is invited to come picnic and experience a classic movie while laying down with some of Hollywood’s most noted founders and celebrities. This week is no different;Roman Polanski’s Chinatown is on the bill, and we can’t wait for it. Never has visiting the dead been so much fun.

6/25: Haven Gastropub + Brewery is without a doubt one of our favorite spots for guzzling craft beers and noshing on things like beer-soaked, housemade potato chips or hand-twisted pretzels with bacon-fontina cheese sauce—I mean, we can always eat Kale later right? This Monday night, Haven’s Executive Chef Greg Daniels is roasting a whole suckling pig to be served tableside as part of KCRW and Dine LA’s Dinner Date series. Tickets to this Los Angeles event are $30 (excluding beverages and gratuity), and all proceeds go towards KCRW.

These are just two Los Angeles events from this week. Make sure to always check up on our website, LACANVAS.com for an up to date calendar of Los Angeles events we’re stoked for.
